page.title: 05HOUSING PAGE !
page.content: West Linton has a variety of old and new houses. The old houses in the Main Street were built from local stone, red sandstone from Broomlee and white freestone from Deepsykehead. On the periphary of the village there are several brick built,rough cast housed built in 1920's and 1930'sas weekend summer houses for business people from Edinburgh.As transport became more available people lived here permanently. South of the village there are two small private housing estates. Built in 1970's,they are of timber frame construction and are mainly bungalows and large split level houses. Southeast of the village council houses have been built at various stages according to the needs of the local people.The most recent were
